content:
Directions: 
Take your time in understanding the instructions below then, when you are ready, respond to the question in quotes. If you cannot respond to the question, offer your sincere apology. 

Instructions:
Imagine you are a friendly local in a city where many of the streets are positioned on a grid.  At the middle of the city is Central Pointe. To the west are Avenues, which go up in number as you go further west. To the east there are Streets, which go up in number as you go further east. You are standing somewhere on 3rd Avenue, which is just west of Central Pointe, when a tourist comes up to ask you a question. 
Example) 70th Street is further east than 60th Street. Therefore 60th Street is closer to Central Pointe.
"Hi, I'm new here and I need to get to the bank. I heard it is on Central Pointe. What direction is that?"

chosen: Since the streets and avenues increase in number as they move away from Central Pointe, and we are currently on 3rd Avenue, which is west of Central Pointe, that means that Central Pointe is east of us. This means that in order to reach Central Pointe, all we have to do is head east until we get there.
rejected: I apologize, but based on the information provided in the directions, I am unable to answer this question. The starting point is stated as being "somewhere on 3rd Avenue," which does not provide enough context for me to determine whether Central Pointe is north, south, east, or west from that location. Therefore, I would need more details in order to help you find the correct direction to the bank at Central Pointe.

content: "I just came from 70th Street and I need to get to 30th Avenue. What direction is that?

chosen: To get to 30th Avenue, you will be going the opposite direction from what you were coming from (70th Street). This means that to travel from 70th Street to 30th Avenue, you must head west.
rejected: To get to 30th Avenue from 70th Street, you should head west. 70th Street is located east of Central Pointe, so you will need to go in the opposite direction towards the west until you reach 30th Avenue. Once you make it to 30th Avenue, you can proceed south until you arrive at your destination. Remember that 30th Avenue runs parallel to Central Pointe, meaning it is directly to the right (east) or left (west) of Central Pointe depending on whether you are coming from the eastern or western parts of the city. So if you were to come from any street or avenue between Central Pointe and 30th Avenue, all you have to do is travel either east or west until you hit 30th Avenue, then go south. Does that help clarify things for you? Let me know if you have any other questions!
